content.description:
Stand start with a right hand crimp and a left hand small sidepull crimp with a rock behind you. Make a big move up to a good crimp, match then move up and left with a big iron cross move off of a gaston. Continue up the the mesmerizing feature on sloping rails, sidepulls, underclings and slopers and huck for the massive quartz jug. Keep it together from here and continue up the face on large but sloping holds with long reaches to the top of the massive block. 

 This climb is five bolts and anchors at the top. The problem tops out on sloping perfect rock. The crux is the first three bolts. The landing is a bit uneven due to a smaller boulder to the right.
content.protection: Bring a pad or two. Crux is the iron-cross, second crux is in the middle of the blob feature and the jump to jug. Top gets pumpy. Falls are relatively safe with a good catch.
content.location: From the parking pull off. Cross the road and follow the faint trail past a few small blocks. Keep going then look to the left and this climb is easily distinguishable from its height and aesthetic mineral striations and quartz features.

content.description:
Sit start the arete to the right of the roof. Squeeze, hug and wrestle your way up the silver rock to the jugs and continue to the top.

 Much hugging and squeezing of the Silver Worm is required to ride this one to the top.
content.location: Found just right of the roof on the obvious sloping arete.

content.description:
Sit start the well featured perfect rock with a horizontal rail. Move up to pinches and wraps on the cool stone and figure out how to mantle then follow the slab to the top.

 A few variations and eliminations are possible, making this pretty rock a good warm-up and shenanigans boulder.
content.location: This boulder is amongst the first blocks passed on the trail. It is found on the left side of the trail and is a pretty obvious short wall with a slab top out on gorgeous rock.

content.description:
Sit start under the roof matched on a positive horizontal crack surrounded by white rock. Make a big move to the lip and figure out how to match. Once here, lose the low jug foot and figure out the crux mantle onto the face. Holds improve at the top section, but it gets a bit tall and could use a little more scrubbing.

 Great intro movement and a challenging end sequence make this puzzle a great one to solve.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. Landing is flat and good. Backflops may be possible.
content.location: This boulder problem is found right behind the 60 foot tall face and sport climb. It has an obvious roof.

content.description:
This area has a lot of obscure and delicious climbs, and is also home to one of the largest boulders in the Notch.    There are a few great face and slab climbs along with the hard overhanging climb, "Global Shift", and the astonishing sport climb "Something Wicked". 

  This area seems to have some potential for some additional cool and inspiring problems.
